topic.title: Flash

body.p: The flash contains 512 KB of programmable memory and 3 × 8 KB information pages for general use. It also contains 1 × 8 KB of manufacturing information which cannot be programmed. The CPUs may execute directly from the flash using their cache controllers.

The flash may be programmed from the SPI2AHB, JTAG7, over-the-air (OTA), or UART bootloader. The CPUs may also program a page of the flash while executing out of other pages for over-the-air updates. Up to 10,000 erase-program cycles are permitted. The flash may be erased one 8 KB page at a time.
The user may program IO port protection in the flash to prevent access to the flash or to other parts of the device from various external sources and also disable service mode operation.
Flash data contains error correction coding (ECC). Single-bit errors in 2 × 32 bit words can be detected and corrected, and double-bit errors can be detected.
